definition: to work overtime
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
team/class/squad/work shift/ranking/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for groups
surname Ban

sentences.english: Able to work under pressure, working independently, willingness to work overtime or work with shift.
sentences.chinese: 具抗压性，能独立作业，并配合加班及轮班。

sentences.english: On behalf of the staff at Canada Weifang Secondary School (CWSS), we would like to welcome you.
sentences.chinese: 代表中加班的教职员工，我们对您表示衷心地欢迎。

sentences.english: It was also announced that all police leave has been cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 同时，所有休假的警察都已被要求回岗加班。

sentences.english: As a professional, your position will not be entitled for overtime payment.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个专业人士，你的岗位不会获得任何加班补贴。

sentences.english: Working overtime for days made him mentally and physically exhausted.
sentences.chinese: 加班使他身心十分疲敝。

sentences.english: On holiday the railways run extra trains for special purpose.
sentences.chinese: 假日铁路增开加班火车。

sentences.english: Is a worker terminated or disciplined who is not willing to work in overtimes ?
sentences.chinese: 不愿加班的工人是否会被解雇或纪律处罚？

sentences.english: EXAMPLE: Our boss was a stern old grinch who made us work on holidays.
sentences.chinese: 我们的严厉老板总是败人兴致，让我们在假日加班。

sentences.english: We hope you will contribute unstintingly to the Gum my Bears Overtime Fund.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望诸位为“小熊糖加班基金”慷慨解囊。

sentences.english: If Beijing hao's travel, work overtime and put YangManLi children home.
sentences.chinese: 假如郝京妮加班和出差，孩子就放杨曼莉家。

sentences.english: B. 4.3 Do all employees receive paid leave according to statutory regulations?
sentences.chinese: 法律要求的加班补偿支付给所有员工了吗？

sentences.english: Transport run extra trains during the rush-hour.
sentences.chinese: 伦敦运输公司在交通高峰时间增开加班列车。

sentences.english: To this end, my mother has lost substantial section of country which overtime pay.
sentences.chinese: 为此，妈妈失去了国兴节丰厚的加班工资。

sentences.english: Don't forget to sign your overtime on our roll book .
sentences.chinese: 别忘了在公司考勤表上签上你的加班时间。

sentences.english: Willing to work overtime, result-oriented and hard working spirit.
sentences.chinese: 勤奋，愿意加班，以结果为导向。

sentences.english: After working day after day, we can finish the work before it's due.
sentences.chinese: 加班，这项工作总算是可以刻期完成了。

definition: to finish work/to get off work
to go to work/to be on duty/to start work/to go to the office
night shift
working hours
to shift holidays, taking a weekday off
time of going to work/the morning rush hour
to change shifts/to work in turns
to stay up late or all night
to take a vacation/to go on holiday
(Internet slang) to be dog-tired
karoshi (loanword from Japanese), death from overwork
all night/throughout the night
to go on an official or business trip
three-shift system (work rostering)
to take deferred time off (to make up for working during the weekend or holidays)/compensatory leave
to request leave of absence
